interestingFact: There are 195 countries in the world today, including 193 United Nations member states and 2 observer states.
Flora: Flora worldwide includes diverse plants like sequoias, orchids, and cacti.
Fauna: Fauna ranges from polar bears and tigers to kangaroos and whales, each adapted to their unique habitats.

interestingFact: India is the world's largest democracy and is home to over 2,000 distinct ethnic groups and more than 1,600 languages.
Flora: Rich biodiversity with tropical rainforests, deciduous trees, and medicinal plants
Fauna: Bengal tiger, Indian elephant, Indian rhinoceros, and peacock.

interestingFact: Nepal is home to Mount Everest, the tallest mountain in the world, standing at 8,848 meters.
Flora: Alpine plants, rhododendrons, oak, and pine forests.
Fauna: Bengal tiger, snow leopard, red panda, and Himalayan monal.

interestingFact: The Pyramids of Giza are one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
Flora: Desert vegetation, date palms, acacia, and papyrus.
Fauna: Nile crocodile, Egyptian goose, sand fox, and dromedary camel.

interestingFact: Australia is home to the Great Barrier Reef, the largest coral reef system in the world.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, the largest tropical rainforest in the world.
Flora: Amazon rainforest, rubber trees, and Brazil nuts.

interestingFact: The Eiffel Tower in Paris was once the tallest man-made structure in the world.
Flora: Vineyards, lavender fields, and temperate forests.
Fauna: Red deer, wild boar, European rabbit, and European brown bear.

interestingFact: Russia is the largest country in the world by area, covering more than 17 million square kilometers.
Flora: Taiga forests, birch trees, and tundra vegetation.
Fauna: Siberian tiger, brown bear, snow leopard, and reindeer.

interestingFact: The Great Wall of China is visible from space on rare occasions.
Flora: Bamboo forests, ginkgo trees, and rice paddies.
Fauna: Giant panda, golden monkey, Tibetan antelope, and Chinese alligator.
